# start()

**Instance Method**

Starts the audio engine.

## Declaration

```swift
func start() throws
```

## Discussion

This method calls the [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioEngine/prepare()] method if you don’t call it after invoking [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioEngine/stop()]. It then starts the audio hardware through the [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioInputNode] and [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioOutputNode] instances in the audio engine. This method throws an error when:

- There’s a problem in the structure of the graph, such as the input can’t route to an output or to a recording tap through converter nodes.
- An [doc://com.apple.avfaudio/documentation/AVFAudio/AVAudioSession] error occurs.
- The driver fails to start the hardware.

## Playing Audio

- **prepare()**: Prepares the audio engine for starting.
- **isRunning**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the audio engine is running.
- **pause()**: Pauses the audio engine.
- **stop()**: Stops the audio engine and releases any previously prepared resources.
- **reset()**: Resets all audio nodes in the audio engine.
- **musicSequence**: The music sequence instance that you attach to the audio engine, if any.
